meanings.definition: A person who believes in the existence of individual spirits that inhabit natural objects and phenomena.
meanings.sent1: The animists in the village pray to the spirits of the trees for protection.
meanings.sent2: Many animists around the world have deep respect for nature and its spirits.
meanings.sent3: The animists chuckled when they thought the river's spirit was playing tricks on them.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with the curiosity of an animist exploring the mysteries of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The old man's stories about the animists' connection to the land were captivating.

meanings.definition: Belonging to or characteristic of animists.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ritual had an animist charm that enchanted the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The animist beliefs influenced the design of the traditional artwork.
meanings.sent3: The animist decorations added a touch of magic to the room.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had an animist pattern that seemed to come alive in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The animist symbols on the shield represented protection and unity.

meanings.definition: The belief in a supernatural power that organizes and animates the material universe.
meanings.sent1: The animists' faith in the cosmic energy connected them to the universe.
meanings.sent2: The concept of animists' spirits guiding the stars fascinated the young astronomer.
meanings.sent3: The animists' idea of the wind as a playful force made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings captured the essence of animists' belief in the harmony of all things.
meanings.sent5: The animists' rituals celebrated the dance of life in every living being.
